content: were one chain 110 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st stitch and all chains across 108 stitches made or holding two strands of yarn together as if they were one foundation double crochet 108 stitches see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 108 stitches made row 2 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in the space between the first and second stitches of the previous row this is the very first space double_crochet into each space between the stitches of the row below until you get to the last space which will be a bit smaller than the others skip this last space and double_crochet into the last stitch instead which will be the top of the starting chain from the previous row 108 stitches made row 3-end repeat row 2 108 stitches in each row depending on the yardage of your mandala cakes and your crochet gauge you will get between 52 and 62 row from 4 cakes fasten_off and weave in any ends see the tutorial section below or the video tutorial at https //youtu be/mt6xjggwqkq for more information share your project with #lifesnotarace on instagram and post it in our pretty peaceful people group on facebook tag @prettypeacefulcrochet too ♥☺ life s not a race crochet pattern © 2020 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful pattern tutorial this tutorial shows the technique using only one strand of yarn instead of two strands of yarn held doubled to make it easier to see where the stitches go starting each row to start row 2 and every other row chain 3 or use the chainless starting double_crochet technique shown in the photo below this counts as your first stitch of the row here s how to chainless starting double_crochet http //www mooglyblog com/chainless-starting-double-crochet/ then double_crochet into the space between the double_crochet stitches of the row below crochet into the space marked by the gold needle below you are crocheting into this big space instead of crocheting into the smaller space below the top two loops of each double_crochet stitch like you normally would life s not a race crochet pattern © 2020 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful your second stitch is complete double_crochet into the next space between the double_crochet stitches from the row below this space is marked by the gold needle in the photo below life s not a race crochet pattern © 2020 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful continue to double_crochet into each space between stiches of the row below try doing it by feel- find this space with your fingers instead of with your eyes great for crocheting in low light finishing a row crochet into the spaces between the stitches from the row below until you get to the last space this space is a little smaller than the others do not crochet into the last space between stiches of the row below you will skip this space it is marked by the gold
